body: Jessica the geologist is studying rocks at Yosemite National Park and observes a large rock formation with many thin layers peeling from it, like an onion. This feature was most likely formed by what type of weathering that causes layers of rock to gradually separate from a massive rock?
Which of the following best describes shear stress in rocks?

choices.W: Differential stress that squeezes a rock mass like a vise
choices.X: Differential stress that elongates rock bodies
choices.Y: Differential stress that causes one part of a rock body to slide past another
choices.Z: Differential stress that is applied gradually, causing rocks to deform elastically

answer: Y) DIFFERENTIAL STRESS THAT CAUSES ONE PART OF A ROCK BODY TO SLIDE PAST ANOTHER

body: Which of the following satellites has the highest albedo in the solar system?
What is the reduced mass of a binary star system with stars of masses 4 and 6 solar masses?
What type of unconformity is demonstrated when a sedimentary rock like shale lies over an older intrusive igneous rock like granite?
What type of air lifting mechanism occurs along air mass boundaries when warm air is pushed up to form large clouds?
What natural cycle describes a personâ€™s daily sleep and wake cycle?
In biology, what type of behavior practices helping other individuals at a cost to oneself?
Which of the following vitamins is NOT water-soluble?
Order the following 4 steps of glucose breakdown from first to last: 1) Oxidative phosphorylation; 2) Glycolysis; 3) Oxidation of pyruvate; 4) TCA cycle.
Which of the following types of algae contain seaweeds and is the most complex?
What is the name of the protective bony structure that covers the breathing gills of a fish?
What is the name of the state when the forward rate of a reaction is equal to the reverse rate?
What is the molecular geometry of phosphorus pentachloride?
What unitless quantity gives the ratio of the speed of light in a vacuum to the speed of light in a certain material?
Which of the following units measures the ratio between the moles of solute to the kilogram mass of the solvent?
Which of the following substances would have the lowest vapor pressure at room temperature?
What is the molecular geometry of the sulfur atom in IF5?
What is the polar form of the point with rectangular coordinates (2, 2 root 3)?

An ellipse is constructed on the coordinate plane with equation $x^2 /16 + y^2 /81 = 1$. A circle is then constructed with equation $x^2 + y^2 = 9$. What is the value of the area inside the ellipse but outside the circle?
Which of the following constants is equal to the sum of the reciprocal of the factorials of the whole numbers?
If January 1st in a given year fell on a Sunday, assuming that there is no leap day, on what day of the week would December 15th fall?
If the recursive sequence $t_n$ is defined by $t_n = 2t_{n-1} + 4$ and $t_1 = 3$, what is the value of $t_4$?

Eddy has a beylade collection. He tells you that when he divides his beylades evenly into sets of 7 he has 2 left over, and when he divides them into sets of 13 he has 1 left over. From this information, you cannot determine his exact number of beylades, but you can determine the infinite list of solutions for how many stamps he could have. What is the difference between each solution in this list?
Scientists at Idaho National Lab are studying isotope stability. Which of the following is the most stable isotope of carbon?

Scientists at Lawrence Berkeley National Lab are studying the mechanisms of asexual reproduction in bees. What type of asexual reproduction utilized by some bee species involves the development of the egg without being fertilized?

Scientists at Princeton Plasma Physics Lab are looking into the history of the moon by studying the craters that formed. These craters were formed during what period where there was an increased surge in debris impact rate?
Scientists at Los Alamos National Lab are studying types of magnetism. Which of the following is indicated by the presence of paramagnetism in a molecule?

choices.X: The molecule possesses no unpaired electrons

answer: W) THE MOLECULE POSSESSES UNPAIRED ELECTRONS
